'Marseille' (; , locally: ; ; also 'Marseilles' in English),
known in antiquity as 'Masalia', 'Massalia' or 'Massilia' (from ; 'See:' *
*, Chapter 2, Massilia and Rome before 390 B.C. probably adapted from a
pre-existing language related to Ligurian) is the second largest city
in France, after Paris, with a population of 853,000 within its administrative
limits on a land area of . The urban area and metropolitan area of Marseille
extends beyond the city limits with a population of around 1.6 million. [http://www.demographia.com/db-
worldua.pdf Demographia: World Urban Areas], March 2010 European
Spatial Planning Observation Network, [http://www.espon.eu/export/sites/default-
/Documents/Projects/ESPON2006Projects/StudiesScientificSupportProjects/UrbanFun-
ctions/fr-1.4.3_April2007-final.pdf Study on Urban Functions (Project 1.4.3)],
Final Report, Chapter 3, (ESPON, 2007) [http://www.recensement-
2006.insee.fr/chiffresCles.action?codeMessage=5&zoneSearchField=MARSEILLE&codeZ-
one=003-AU1999&idTheme=3&rechercher=Rechercher Insee - RÃ©sultats du recensement
de la population - Marseille-Aix-en-Provence], 2006 Located on the
southeast coast of France, Marseille is France's largest city on the
Mediterranean coast and largest commercial port. Marseille is the capital of the
Provence-Alpes-CÃ´te d'Azur region, as well as the capital of the Bouches-du-
RhÃ´ne department. Its inhabitants are called Marseillais in French and MarselhÃ©s
in Occitan.
